person:biography.personal-details:content: Immunotherapy has evolved as a new modality for the treatment of patients with cancer. Although clinical responses are impressive, at present we cannot accurately predict which patients will or will not respond to immune-therapeutics. Multi spectral imaging of the tumor microenvironment in situ sheds light on the number, composition and proximity of tumor infiltrating or tumor surrounding immune cells. Apart from a better understanding of tumor biology this may also lead to future application in immunotherapy in order to predict responders from non-responders in patients with cancer.
